intro: Psychotria amita f. canaguensis, commonly known as the Canaguense Psychotria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. The species is noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
